envelope.title: Expand Lattice Atlas With New Drift Susceptibility Axis
envelope.author: Louis Pearson

proposal.summary: This proposal introduces a new drift-susceptibility axis into the Lattice Atlas to improve predictive drift modeling and enhance evaluator sensitivity to multi-agent perturbations.
proposal.motivation: As the governance organism evolves, the current 10-axis Lattice Atlas shows increasing saturation in drift classification. Adding a dedicated susceptibility axis improves resolution, reduces false positives in divergence detection, and strengthens Article XII predictive modeling.

actions.label: Drift Susceptibility Axis
actions.description: Measures susceptibility to multi-agent drift amplification and perturbation resonance.

changes: Add susceptibility scoring to all 60 vertices

constitutional.notes: The new axis must remain subordinate to ψ₅ and SE, and cannot introduce new sources of authority. All susceptibility scoring must be validated through BIV and remain within envelope bounds.
